section.section: An applicant for a license shall submit an application to the sheriff.
The sheriff shall retain the copies of the applicant's verification of tax exemption and charter.

The sheriff may issue a license:
for one or more specific dates; or
for a period not exceeding 1 year.
The licensing year shall run from July 1 through the following June 30.

The license shall state:
the dates that the game will be conducted;
the place that the game will be conducted; and
the type of game authorized.
Except as provided under paragraph (2) of this subsection, a licensee may not conduct a game on Sunday.
A licensee may operate a raffle on Sunday.
A raffle is considered to be operated on the day that the licensee selects the raffle winner.
The sheriff shall license a 50/50 game operated for a period of more than 1 day as a raffle.

A licensee may not allow a child who is under the age of 16 years to:
operate a game or gaming device for which a license is issued under this subtitle;
conduct a game in which a gaming device is operated; or
play or participate in a game in which a gaming device is operated.
